summary:
Oni are mythical creatures in Japanese stories, often described as demons or ogres. They are strong and scary, with horns, big teeth, and sometimes a third eye. Oni live in mountains and caves and are known for eating people, especially in old tales. They can change their appearance to trick victims.

One famous oni is Shuten-d≈çji, considered the strongest. His story is told through many art forms. Oni are often shown in Japanese art and stories as evil characters. However, modern stories make them less frightening.
title: Oni
